title: Closure
content: Closures are created every time a function is created, at function creation time. A closure gives access to an outer function’s scope from an inner function. Nested functions have access to variables declared in their outer scope. We have possibility to emulate private methods using closures. For every closure we have three scopes: Local Scope (Own scope), Outer Functions Scope and Global Scope.

title: useCallback vs useMemo
content: useCallback and useMemo both expect a function and an array of dependencies. The difference is that useCallback returns its function when the dependencies change while useMemo calls its function and returns the result.useCallback returns its function uncalled so you can call it later, while useMemo calls its function and returns the result. usMemo only does a shallow comparison of props and prop’s objects.Shallow compare does check for equality. When comparing scalar values (numbers, strings) it compares their values. When comparing objects, it does not compare their's attributes - only their references are compared (do they point to same object).

title: What is Variable Shadowing in JavaScript?
content: If we declare a variable within a certain scope (decision block, function, or inner class) and it has the same name as a variable declared in an outer scope, it's totally fine. They can exist both with no throwing errors. This is called variable shadowing.

title: Visual Studio Code shortcuts
content:
alt + ↑ Move Line Up

alt + ↓ Move Line Down

shift + alt + ↑ Copy Line up

shift + alt + ↓ Copy Line down

ctrl + enter Insert Line Below

ctrl + shift + enter Insert Line Above

ctrl + 0 Focus Side Bar

ctrl + 1 Focus First Editors Group

ctrl + d Select Current

ctrl + e Go To File

ctrl + shift + p -> new file
